benchmark_details.name: Tool-Reflection-Bench
benchmark_details.overview: Tool-Reflection-Bench is a lightweight benchmark dataset that programmatically verifies structural validity, executability, parameter correctness, and result consistency in multi-turn tool interactions by constructing tasks as miniature trajectories of Erroneous Call → Reflection → Corrected Call.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of structured reflection in enhancing the accuracy and reliability of tool interactions in large language models.

data.source: Constructed from real interaction scenarios and existing tool-call datasets with added perturbations to create failure cases.

methodology.calculation: Evaluation based on structural validity, executability, parameter correctness, and result consistency.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is determined by the correct identification and correction of errors during tool call interactions.
